thread.title: Soccer: Nutley's boys and girls teams advance to the quarterfinals of the Essex County Tournaments
thread.title_full: Soccer: Nutley's boys and girls teams advance to the quarterfinals of the Essex County Tournaments

title: Soccer: Nutley's boys and girls teams advance to the quarterfinals of the Essex County Tournaments
text:
Buy this photo James Connelly for the Nutley Sun The Nutley boys' soccer team defeated Millburn Wednesday afternoon to advance to the quarterfinal of the Essex County Tournament. 
Boys Soccer 
The Nutley boys' soccer team defeated Millburn Wednesday afternoon by a score of 4-3, to advance to the quarterfinal of the Essex County Tournament. 
After playing to a 3-3 stalemate at the end of regulation, the two teams battled through a scoreless first overtime session. In the opening minutes of the second overtime period, Anthony DeBlasio ripped his second goal of the game to advance the No. 9 seed Raiders past No. 8 seed Millburn. 
Will Montgomery and Geoffrey Bevere teamed up to account for the other two Raider goals in a hard fought victory for Nutley. 
Saturday, Oct. 24, the boys will face off against No. 1 seed West Orange, at West Orange High School for a 4 p.m. start in the quarterfinal of the Essex County Tournament. 
The winner of this match will advance to the semifinals, which will be held at Belleville High School on Wednesday Oct. 28, to face the winner of a meeting between No. 12 West Essex and No. 4 Livingston. 
Other games to be played Saturday on the opposite side of the bracket; No. 2 Seton Hall Prep will face No. 7 Bloomfield; while No. 6 Newark Academy will take on No. 3 Montclair. 
Girls Soccer 
On Wednesday night, the Nutley girls' soccer team advanced past No. 13 Bloomfield in the first round of the Essex County Tournament, winning by a score of 1-0. 
No. 5 Nutley came into this neighborhood rivalry matchup with the hot hand, having beaten Verona and a very strong Glen Ridge team to finish off their slate of regular season games. 
They continued their winning ways in their first action of the County tournament as Zoe Steck scored the only goal for the Raiders in the closing minutes of the first half. 
The Raiders' suffocating defense made the goal stand up as they have advanced to the quarterfinals, where they will take on No. 4 Livingston on Saturday, Oct. 24 at Livingston High School for a 3:30 p.m. start. 
The Raiders are no strangers to the Lancers, who have handed Nutley two regular season losses in close overtime games. 
This matchup will certainly be a closely contested game as the Raiders attempt to advance to the semifinals, which will be held at Millburn High School on Wednesday Oct. 28. 
If the Raiders advance, they will play the winner of No. 1 Montclair versus No. 9 Newark Academy. 
On the other side of the bracket; No. 2 Glen Ridge plays No. 10 Columbia this afternoon; No. 6 Caldwell will play No. 3 Montclair Kimberley Academy. 
The County final will be held at Livingston High School on Saturday Oct. 31.
